slides.title: Ancient Egypt: Pyramids and Pharaohs
slides.content: Learn about the magnificent pyramids of Egypt and the pharaohs who built them

slides.title: The Great Pyramids
slides.content: The Great Pyramids of Giza are among the most impressive structures ever built, constructed around 2500 BCE

slides.title: Pharaohs and Dynasties
slides.content: Pharaohs ruled ancient Egypt for over 3000 years, organizing one of the world's greatest civilizations

slides.title: Hieroglyphics
slides.content: Ancient Egyptians used hieroglyphics as their writing system, which was finally decoded in 1822

slides.title: The Roman Empire
slides.content: One of the most powerful civilizations in history, the Roman Empire lasted over 1000 years

slides.title: The Colosseum
slides.content: The Colosseum is an iconic amphitheater built in Rome between 70-80 CE, able to hold 50,000 spectators

slides.title: Roman Government
slides.content: The Romans developed complex governmental systems including the Senate and laws that influence modern governments

slides.title: Fall of Rome
slides.content: The Western Roman Empire fell in 476 CE due to political instability, invasions, and economic decline

slides.title: Medieval Castles
slides.content: Castles were built during the Middle Ages as strongholds for nobility and military defense

slides.title: Castle Architecture
slides.content: Medieval castles featured high walls, towers, moats, and drawbridges for protection

slides.title: Famous Castles
slides.content: Notable castles include Windsor Castle in England, Neuschwanstein Castle in Germany, and Mont-Saint-Michel in France

slides.title: Life in a Castle
slides.content: Castles were not just military fortresses but also homes to nobility, with complex social hierarchies

slides.title: Ancient Greece
slides.content: Ancient Greece was the birthplace of Western democracy, philosophy, and Olympic games

slides.title: Greek Philosophers
slides.content: Great thinkers like Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle shaped Western philosophy and education

slides.title: Athenian Democracy
slides.content: Athens developed the first democratic government where citizens could vote on important decisions

slides.title: The Parthenon
slides.content: The Parthenon is a temple dedicated to Athena, built on the Acropolis in Athens between 447-432 BCE

slides.title: Archaeology Methods
slides.content: Archaeologists use scientific methods to discover, document, and preserve ancient artifacts and structures

slides.title: Excavation Techniques
slides.content: Careful excavation is done layer by layer (stratigraphy) to understand the chronology of artifacts

slides.title: Dating Methods
slides.content: Archaeologists use radiocarbon dating, thermoluminescence, and other scientific methods to determine artifact age

slides.title: Artifact Preservation
slides.content: Once discovered, artifacts are carefully preserved and studied to learn about ancient civilizations
